data.description: Job Posting Title:Content & Brand Insights Intern, Summer/Fall 2026Req ID:10138492Job Description:About the Role & Program:Disney Entertainment’s Research, Insights & Analytics (RIA) division serves as a center of excellence, consisting of more than 100 world-class researchers who measure all aspects of media consumption across a wide range of networks, digital properties, and SVOD services to guide The Walt Disney Company.This role will support the Content, Consumer, & Brand Insights team, the team responsible for providing actionable, data-driven consumer insights to inform decision-making for Development, Programming, Marketing, and Strategy across some of the most recognizable brands on television. This internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in the Burbank, CA area from June 2026-January 2027.What You Will Do:Assist with project management: Support various aspects of qualitative and quantitative research, including logistics, coordination, reviewing discussion guides, managing stimuli, taking notes, reviewing questionnaires, proofing links, and helping with data analysis and visualization.Support ad-hoc requests: Analyze a variety of resources, summarize key insights, and communicate findings effectively.Create presentations and deliverables: Help create impactful presentations and deliverables using relevant data visualization techniques and assist in editing and distilling findings.Provide insights: Contribute insights into topics impacting our audience, including current content landscape trends and viewing behavior.Ensure quality and timeliness: Assist in ensuring the quality and timeliness of projects and deliverables by coordinating with internal teams and external research vendors.Required Qualifications & Skills:Experience using Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.Self-starter with passion, energy, and enthusiasm to impact the future of content.Strong communication skills (verbal, written, listening).Exceptional organization, time, and project management skills.Dedication to delivering the highest quality work; unflagging attention to detail.Flexible; embraces new assignments with a can-do attitude as priorities change.Collaborative and able to work across a variety of teams and establish strong relationships.Skilled at data visualization and creating impactful presentations and deliverables.Preferred Qualifications:Advanced computer skills; SPSS, Tableau, or Snowflake experience a plus.Advanced PowerPoint and design skills a plus.Knowledge of Adobe Photoshop.Education:Junior or Senior year preferred.Major or previous coursework in Communications, Marketing, Psychology, Sociology, Media Studies or a related major is preferred.Required Materials:Candidates are asked to submit a writing sample detailing a research project they conducted independently as part of their application.Eligibility Requirements & Program Information:Candidates for this opportunity MUST meet all of the below requirements:Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.Be at least 18 years of agePossess unrestricted work authorization.Additional Information:This internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in the Burbank, CA area from June 2026-January 2027.Able to have a consistent, reliable work schedule throughout the internship.Fully available Monday through Friday for the duration of the internship, 40 hours each week.Able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship program in the Burbank, CA area.Able to provide/have reliable transportation to/from work.Recommendation – Print This Role Description: We encourage applicants to print a copy of this role description so they can refer to it in the event they are selected for an interview. Note that this role description will not be accessible once the posting is closed.The pay rate for this role in California is $22.50 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.Job Posting Segment:Disney NetworksJob Posting Primary Business:Disney Networks AllPrimary Job Posting Category:Data Science and Analytics Intern, Marketing and Digital Media Intern, OtherEmployment Type:Full timePrimary City, State, Region, Postal Code:Burbank, CA, USAAlternate City, State, Region, Postal Code:Date Posted:2026-02-03
requirements: Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.
Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.
Be at least 18 years of age
